elevator.rmi
Class LinkButton

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.LinkButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, RemoteActionListener, java.io.Serializable
public class LinkButton
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements RemoteActionListener

The class LinkButton implements the elevator.rmi.RemoteActionListener interface. An object with the LinkButton class serves as a proxy for receiving action events from a floor button(s), an inside button panel(s) or the timers of the Elevators application via RMI. The LinkButton object maintains a list of listeners interested in receiving action events from the button(s), the panel(s) or the timer. When the LinkButton object receives an action event it forwards the event to all registered listeners. A listener class must implement the java.awt.event.ActionListener interface. Listeners interesting in receiving action commands from inside button panels or floor buttons are added to a LinkButton by the addInsideListener and addFloorListener static methods of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class, respectively. A position listener is added to a LinkButton by the addPositioneListener method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class.

A remote reference to a LinkButton object with the RemoteActionListener interface is passed to a FloorListener (InsideListener or code>PositionListener) object created at the Elevators application which "localy" receives action events from a button or the timer and forwards the event via JavaRMI to the LinkButton which, in its turn, forwards the event to the subscribed listeners.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
ActionListener, ActionEvent, RemoteActionListener, FloorListener, InsideListener, Serialized Form
